abstracts.cdata!:
The November ice storm caused great
            damage to the power distribution network, as well as to
            telecommunications, forest, and agriculture. As a result,
            the power grid was down and related power infrastructure
            severely damaged, water supply, sewage systems, and
            telecommunications were not working, and as a result, many
            schools, hospitals, and businesses were unable to operate.
            An emergency response means up-front costs to the Government
            for Moldova for which they are re-channeling current
            revenues, a lowering of revenues available for expenditures
            in the 2001 budget. Supplemental resources will be disbursed
            throgh a Special Fund for National Calamities. And will
            partly finance import components (cables, tpwers, diesel
            fuel, etc.), some labor costs, and other domestic
            components. Any funds not directly and immediately used for
            emergency relief will constitute general external financing,
            and thus will be available to fund priority needs that
            earlier were delayed in order to re-channel funds to address
            ice storm damages. This supplement is crucial for
            maintaining momentum for the reform program described in the
            Interim Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper (I-PRSP) and the
            Country Assistance Strategy, and supported by the Structural
            Adjustment Credit.
